Articles.Content:
Hello everybody! I'm Jackd44 and today I bought this amazing game. After playing a uh 'Demo' for a week or two, I could finally get this game! So uh yeah, and also I have got to the Mun It's pretty hard to get there currently, especially with the big garage piece. Although I did have to use mechjeb to get it there in the end, because I give up with it.

I also love to play this game with mods, I already have a big list of

  • Kethane
  • ExtraPlanetary Launchpads(Which I love, along with kethane)
  • KAS(Which I still need to learn how to use)
  • LazorCam
  • Mechjeb 2(Probably only for now)
  • Fustek 18 man pod thingy
  • H.O.M.E
  • Finally: The ANT(Or DEMV mk5)

So yeah, that's me. I hope I can really be of help here and I'll try to be as nice as possible(Although I may not be nice to idiots, be aware )

Oh and yeah, are there any good mods that make having a base on another planet/moon more worthwhile other than the ones I have above?

Thanks for reading!

Welcome to KSP!

I think you might want to get a parts pack, to expand the selection of parts (duh) you can use. Popular ones include the B9 pack for spaceplanes, the NovaPunch pack for spaceship parts and the KW Rocketry pack. Also, you might want Kerbal Alarm Clock and Subassembly Manager, they make the game so much easier.

I think you might want to get a parts pack, to expand the selection of parts (duh) you can use. Popular ones include the B9 pack for spaceplanes, the NovaPunch pack for spaceship parts and the KW Rocketry pack. Also, you might want Kerbal Alarm Clock and Subassembly Manager, they make the game so much easier.

Hello, thanks for your suggestions, they're appreciated. Unfortunately I'm not looking for part mods as such(As great as they are though) I'm a bit more into functional ones, Kerbal alarm clock seems like a good one to get, will get that after this post, but where can I find subassembly manager? I'm trying to find it but I'm not having any luck.

Subassembly Manager can be found here.

You might want Kerbal Engineer, it's like MechJeb's info readouts without the autopilot. That's to be found here.
